docs.snippet: The newspaper correspondence in Rome have been guilty, in one sense, of great exaggeration. To read the accounts which some of them write, one would suppose that the city was so unquiet as to be an unsafe residence for foreigners.

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN ROME.; Tranquillity of the External City--The Carnival of 1860--Amusements--Americans atRome.

docs.lead_paragraph: The newspaper correspondence in Rome have been guilty, in one sense, of great exaggeration. To read the accounts which some of them write, one would suppose that the city was so unquiet as to be an unsafe residence for foreigners.

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN ITALY.; MOVEMENTS IN LOMBARDY--APPREHENSION OF THE PEOPLE--PREPARATIONS FOR THE ELECTIONS. FARINI'S PROCLAMATION ORDERING A VOTE ON THE QUESTION OF ANNEXATION. THE AUSTRIAN TYRANNY IN VENETIA.

docs.lead_paragraph: The elections are fixed for the 25th inst., and Parliament is convoked for the 2d of April. One can scarcely overrate the importance of these two facts, which leave, at any rate, no doubt about the resolution of Piedmont to pursue the road once chosen.

docs.snippet: At the meeting of the Board of Aldermen last evening, Alderman SEAGRIST moved to discharge the special committee having the nomination of Dr. BRADFORD for Health Commissioner in charge.

headline.main: CITY GOVERNMENT.; BOARD OF ALDERMEN. THE MAYOR'S NOMINATIONS NOT TAKEN UP--THE WORTH MONUMENT TO BE PROTECTED. BOARD OF COUNCILMEN. TOMPKINS MARKET--OPENING CHAMBERS-STREET-- BELGIAN PAVEMENT. BOARD OF SUPERVISORS. NEW COURT ROOMS--THE MAYOR DEPRECATES HASTY ACTION WITH REGARD TO THEM--THE COMMISSIONERS OF RECORDS AGAIN. OFFICE OF THE CITY INSPECTOR. WEEKLY REPORT OF DEATHS IN THE CITY AND COUNTY OF NEW-YORK.

docs.lead_paragraph: At the meeting of the Board of Aldermen last evening, Alderman SEAGRIST moved to discharge the special committee having the nomination of Dr. BRADFORD for Health Commissioner in charge.

docs.snippet: ITEMS.--The body of a child was found yesterday at the door of No. 113 Clinton-street....Dr. SAMUEL BOYD, late Health Officer, was buried yesterday in the Cemetery of the Evergreens.

headline.main: FROM WASHINGTON.; THE HOMESTEAD BILL IN THE SENATE. Speech by Mr. Cox, of Ohio, on the Disorganized Condition of Mexico.The Democratic Convention to be Held at Charleston. PROCEEDINGS OF THE SENATE. PROCEEDINGS OF THE HOUSE. REMOVALS FROM OFFICE. THE DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION TO BE HELD AT CHARLESTON. PERSONAL ITEMS. From Another Correspondent. THE MEXICAN TREATY. From the Associated Press.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate, to-day, was engaged on equally important bills--the Homestead and Florida claims. The latter involves the much-mooted point of the interest payable by Government, and was reported against by the Court of Claims. Strange to say, Sentor TOOMBS advocated the bill.

docs.snippet: ALBANY, MONDAY, March 19, 1860. The excitement among the politicians about the  passage of the Toll bill, as it went through the Senate, increases rather than diminishes.

headline.main: NOTES FROM THE STATE CAPITAL.; THE RAILROAD TOLL BILL--EXCITEMENT REGARDING IT--BUSINESS IN THE SENATE AND ASSEMBLY--THE ATLANTIC-STREET TUNNEL--THE CITY CHARTER.

docs.lead_paragraph: ALBANY, MONDAY, March 19, 1860. The excitement among the politicians about the passage of the Toll bill, as it went through the Senate, increases rather than diminishes.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Monday, March 19. Mr. MORRILL, of Vermont, (Rep.,) from the Com  mittee on Ways and Means, reported a bill to provide for the payment of outstanding Treasury notes; to authorize a loan; regulating and increasing the duties on imports, and...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Monday, March 19. Mr. MORRILL, of Vermont, (Rep.,) from the Com mittee on Ways and Means, reported a bill to provide for the payment of outstanding Treasury notes; to authorize a loan; regulating and increasing the duties on imports, and for other purposes.

docs.snippet: We have important news from Mexico. The details of the news by the Star of the West are at hand. By telegraph from New-Orleans we learn that the Mexican war steamers General Miramon and Marquez are at that port, in charge of Lieutenants MINOR and...
docs.lead_paragraph: We have important news from Mexico. The details of the news by the Star of the West are at hand. By telegraph from New-Orleans we learn that the Mexican war steamers General Miramon and Marquez are at that port, in charge of Lieutenants MINOR and CHAPMAN, of the Saratoga.
